data.title: University of Fribourg
data.text:
Getting to Fribourg

By airplane

Our region is about an hour and a half away from Switzerland's three main airports, respectively Zurich-Kloten, Geneva-Cointrin and Basel-Mulhouse.

Direct train to Fribourg is offered from Zurich airport and Geneva airport.

By train

The Swiss Federal Railways (SBB) serve most of the major transport axes in Switzerland. You will find timetables for nearly all of Switzerland's public transport on the SBB website or the SBB app, which is suggested to be installed on your smart phone. Tickets can be bought beforehand on the website or app if you have a credit card.

When arriving in Switzerland at one of the airports, it is highly recommended to take train coming to Fribourg. The following table summarizes the basic information about the train ride. Learn timetable and more on the SBB website.

*last update: July 2020, price is subject to SBB

Where do I buy train ticket?

At ticket vending machine or staffed ticket counter at train station.

At the SBB website or the SBB app if you can pay by credit card.

What is a half-fare travel card and its advantages?

Read here.

Where and how can I buy a half-fare travel card?

Read here.

A good practice could be: When arriving at the Zurich/Geneva airport train station or Basel train station, go to the staffed SBB ticket counter (when it is open) and purchase a half-fare card there. You need passport, a passport picture and an address in Switzerland. A temporary half-fare travel card will be issued on spot with which you can immediately enjoy the 50% on the ticket to Fribourg.
